name: ceremony
content:
ceremony noun
(FORMAL ACTS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 [ C or U ] (formal ceremonial) (a set of) formal acts, often fixed and traditional, performed on important social or religious occasions: a wedding/graduation ceremony
More examplesFewer examplesWe weren't married in church, but we had a civil ceremony in a registry office.The Olympics climaxed in a spectacular closing ceremony.The glittering ceremony conjured up images of Russia's imperial past.Several foreign dignitaries attended the ceremony.The queen, in full ceremonial dress, presided over the ceremony.

(FORMAL BEHAVIOUR)
